This is on my must-do list.
a must-have for any fan

senses.definition: in certain situations it is necessary for you to do something that you do not like or enjoy
used to describe feelings that two or more people have for each other equally, or actions that affect two or more people equally

examples.x: mutual respect/understanding
mutual support/aid
They parted by mutual consent.
I don't like her, and I think the feeling is mutual (= she doesn't like me either).

senses.definition: shared by two or more people

examples.x: We met at the home of a mutual friend.
They soon discovered a mutual interest in music.

senses.definition: of or belonging to the speaker or writer

examples.x: Where's my passport?
My feet are cold.

senses.definition: used in exclamations to express surprise, etc.

examples.x: My goodness! Look at the time.
Oh my! What are we going to do?
My my Megan, I do believe you 're jealous!

senses.definition: used when speaking to somebody, to show love

examples.x: my dear/darling/love

senses.definition: used when speaking to somebody that you consider to have a lower status than you

examples.x: My dear girl, you're wrong.

senses.definition: used when the speaker or writer is also the person affected by an action

examples.x: I cut myself on a knife.
I wrote a message to myself.
I found myself unable to speak.
I haven't been feeling myself recently (= I have not felt well).
I needed space to be myself (= not influenced by other people).

senses.definition: used to emphasize the fact that the speaker is doing something

examples.x: I'll speak to her myself.
I myself do not agree.

senses.definition: alone; without anyone else

examples.x: I live by myself.

senses.definition: without help

examples.x: I painted the room all by myself.

senses.definition: for the speaker or writer alone to have or use; not shared

examples.x: I had a whole pizza to myself.

senses.definition: difficult to understand or explain; strange

examples.x: He died in mysterious circumstances.
the mysterious disappearance of an aircraft
Fate works in mysterious ways.
the events that led up to her mysterious death by drowning
A mysterious illness is affecting all the animals.
The whole thing was very mysterious.

senses.definition: seeming strange or secret

examples.x: The gardens looked dark and mysterious in the twilight.

senses.definition: strange and interesting because you do not know much about them

examples.x: She meets a mysterious stranger who offers to help her.
Her last years remain somewhat mysterious.

senses.definition: not saying much about something, especially when other people want to know more

examples.x: He was being very mysterious about where he was going.
Why are they being so mysterious?

senses.definition: something that is difficult to understand or to explain

examples.x: It is one of the great unsolved mysteries of this century.
Their motives remain a mystery.
She tried to solve the mystery of the boy's sudden death.

examples.cf: It is a mystery to somebody why, how, etc…
examples.x: It's a complete mystery to me why they chose him.

senses.definition: a person or thing that is strange and interesting because you do not know much about them or it

examples.x: He's a bit of a mystery.
There was a mystery guest on the programme.
The mystery man's identity remains hidden.
a mystery disease/illness/virus
a mystery tour (= when you do not know where you are going)
My sister is a complete mystery to me.

senses.definition: the quality of being difficult to understand or to explain, especially when this makes somebody/something seem interesting and exciting

examples.x: Mystery surrounds her disappearance.
His past is shrouded in mystery (= not much is known about it).
The dark glasses give her an air of mystery.
She’s a woman of mystery.

senses.definition: a story, a film or a play in which crimes and strange events are only explained at the end

examples.x: He is the author of several murder mysteries.
The film is based on Daphne DuMaurier's mystery novel, ‘Rebecca’.

senses.definition: secret religious ceremonies; secret knowledge

examples.x: the teacher who initiated me into the mysteries of mathematics

senses.definition: a religious belief that cannot be explained or proved in a scientific way

examples.x: the mystery of creation

senses.definition: a story from ancient times, especially one that was told to explain natural events or to describe the early history of a people; this type of story

examples.x: ancient Greek myths
a creation myth (= that explains how the world began)
the heroes of myth and legend

senses.definition: something that many people believe but that does not exist or is false

examples.x: It is time to dispel the myth of a classless society (= to show that it does not exist).
Contrary to popular myth, women are not worse drivers than men.
